metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15415 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Incorrect serialization in IPC in Google Chrome prior to 63.0.3239.84allowed a remote attacker to leak the value of a pointer via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15415` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
